qas.question: What type of conditions do many garment works endure?
What type of clothing is frequently the product of sweatshops?
What is a feature of sweatshops beyond lack of benefits and representation?
Poor conditions found in developing countries may also be found in what type of nations?
What type of immigrant often staff sweatshops?
Here my clothing is often produced in what?
Most examples of what are found in industrial countries?
What transformed most industry by the 1800s?

context: Though <b9_0>mechanization<b9_0/> transformed most aspects of human industry by the mid-20th century, <b5_0>garment workers<b5_0/> have continued to labor under <a0_0>challenging<a0_0/> conditions that demand repetitive manual labor. <a1_0><b6_0>Mass-produced<a1_0/> clothing<b6_0/> is often made in what are considered by some to be <b7_0><b8_0>sweatshops<b8_0/>,<b7_0/> typified by <a2_0>long work hours<a2_0/>, lack of benefits, and lack of worker representation. While most examples of such conditions are found in developing countries, clothes made in <a3_0>industrialized<a3_0/> nations may also be manufactured similarly, often staffed by <a4_0>undocumented<a4_0/> immigrants.[citation needed]
